Sentence.Original:
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Dear Ashley,
There's something I want to tell you about your mother. I'll be waiting for you at Lake Juliet.
Dad[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, I'm sorry.
Getting ready for camping has taken longer than I thought, so I can't pick you up. I'll wait at the campsite, so go ahead and check in at the guesthouse.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Are you enjoying the barbecue?
I've got a few more things to do here. I'm really sorry but I won't have time to go to the campsite now - can you get my backpack and bring it back to the cottage for me, please?
My cottage is past the covered bridge, on the left.[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, where are you?
I'm back at the cottage now. I thought you'd be here already.
I'm waiting for you here, so hurry.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, where are you?
I'm coming to meet you at the covered bridge, so wait for me there.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, someone found your stolen bag!
I just got a call from Dan, he says he'll bring it to the cottage for you.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, I'm so sorry.
I thought I'd be able to come home earlier, but it looks like I'll be quite late. I may not be back until tomorrow morning. If you don't want to wait, please go on home.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, please come to JC Valley right now. We have no time. Just hurry up![0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, something's happened at the lab.
I'll explain later, but for the moment please take the TAS and go home right away. If you stay here, you could get caught up in something dangerous.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, please come immediately. I am waiting.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, trust no-one.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Ashley, go to Ryan's office.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]ダミー[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Lake Juliet message 1
Ashley, I'm so happy I had the chance to go camping with you.
I want you to know more about the area, so I'm sending you these Lake Juliet messages. They're timed to arrive while you're here camping, so I hope you enjoy reading them.
I heard this story at the photographer's the first time I came to Lake Juliet.
It's a tragic love story connected to the Romeo Mountains and Lake Juliet.
"Once upon a time, a poor boy from the mountains and a girl from the lake fell in love. The boy found a stone that shone with all the colours of the rainbow and, thinking that if he could sell it to afford their marriage, he happily came down from the mountain. But he was in such a hurry that he slipped and fell to his death on the valley floor. The kind-hearted girl was heartbroken and followed her love by throwing herself into the lake. Their families, who had at first opposed the relationship, grieved for their losses. They found the rainbow stone and cast it into the lake. Since that day, mysterious rainbow stones appeared in the Romeo Mountains mines."
They say that if a couple find one of these stones, they are destined to be together forever.[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Lake Juliet message 2
The mines in the Romeo Mountains are closed now, but this is their story.
"Gold was discovered in the Romeo Mountains in the 1920s, and the owner of the mines became fabulously wealthy. He pumped huge amounts of water up from Lake Juliet to wash the gold, and the dirty water went straight back into the lake. Beautiful Lake Juliet became polluted, and the livelihoods of people living nearby were threatened. After the gold ran out and the mines closed, the lake returned to its former beauty."
It would be a tragedy for pollution to hit a lake as beautiful as Lake Juliet.[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Lake Juliet message 3
Ashley, have you seen the mermaid statue? It's part of the next chapter in that sad story about Lake Juliet and the Romeo Mountains.
"They say that the girl threw herself into Lake Juliet after her love died and became a mermaid protecting the lake. There's a legend that on nights with a full moon, she thinks of her lost love and weeps.
They say that if a couple sees those tears in the moonlight, they'll be able to keep their love forever."
I've never seen a mermaid, but the moon over Lake Juliet is beautiful.[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Lake Juliet message 4
One thing you have to mention when talking about Lake Juliet is the Salmon Rice Burger at Bob's diner. It's my favourite, a really delicious burger.
Bob is the restaurant owner, he's a really friendly guy. I heard he used to sing for a country music band, and I told him about not being able to live without a guitar in my hand when I was younger. We've had some great talks together - maybe it's because we're about the same age, but we always end up talking about jazz going out of fashion. Bob says maybe we should get with the program now that rock is becoming popular again.
Let's go to Bob's diner together sometime.[0]

ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Lake Juliet message 5
JC Valley, where I work, is built on the shore of Lake Juliet. I want to show you that unusual underwater building.
I'm doing memory research again with some people I worked with at MJ Labs, where I met your mother.
Ryan Gray He still looks like the boy I first met, but he's a scientific genius. He's very strict about his work, but you can see that he's not satisfied with his methods. Listening to him, you get the impression he's obsessed with the genius of Judd and Sayoko.
Rex Alfred Rex is the person who brought me to JC Valley. He's looking forward to seeing his daughter when she comes home on holiday from boarding school. Hearing that, I remembered that I haven't been home to see you in almost six months. Rex took over JC Valley from its founder, Judd Fitzgerald, and is preoccupied with doing everything he can to expand the company.[0]
ダミー[0]ダミー[0]Lake Juliet message 6[0]
